Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify two different habitats, one on land and one in water, to illustrate.
The student can draw and label different types of living things found in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, and animals like lizards or squirrels.
The student can draw and label different types of living things found in the water habitat, such as fish and plants.
The student can demonstrate through drawings how the living things in each habitat are different but can share similarities.
The student can illustrate patterns observed in the diversity of plants and animals between the two habitats.
